tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids Shame that the Environmental Agency isn’t taking RED industries to account over Walley’s Landfill site at Silverdale, in Newcastle-under-Lyme, Staffordshire that is making thousands of lives a misery due to the daily stench that invades peoples homes and gardens.

Are you frightened to open a window @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @BorisJohnson @Keir_Starmer @DefraGovUK ? I am. I want to sleep but my unventilated house is full if stale, eggy, toxic, air because of the stench from Walleys Landfill and outside the air is poison. #stopthestink

@EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL - This is now just too far, we need action, not excuses or dismissal as the EA gave last week. 

We are people, we deserve fresh air, this woman and her child deserve it right NOW. https://t.co/nMwYsXKokA

Trees protect our rivers and help us fight against #ClimateChange.

We’re planting thousands of trees near rivers and streams to bring benefits to local communities and our environment. 

Find out more:
https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY

#IntlForestDay #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/CdD26qGH7d

@ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids  @DefraGovUK @RedIndustries2 Last night a man got so fed up with the constant fumes, so angered with you and so frustrated that he can do nothing about it, that he tried to take his own life. Hang your heads in shame #scum.
In hospital due to premature Labour and the ward I’m on stinks of landfill!! @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe

As @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA are hiding from the stench of Walleys Landfill. Is it time for @NewsNBC to ask a higher power to record, monitor & regulate?Maybe @BorisJohnson & his malodorous vapours 🤔I’m thinking more of the big guy @StinkStopthe #StopTheStink https://t.co/igjLugVF4U

urls.title: ERDF SUNRISE Project Partnership - Wildflowers, pollinators and birds to benefit from work to improve river habitats in Milton
urls.description: Posted on The River Trent is the third longest river in England, flowing for 185 miles. It starts its epic journey as a natural spring high up on Biddulph Moor, north of Stoke-on-Trent. As it travels through the city it is still in its infancy, and just a few feet wide in places. Nowhere is this more apparent than in Milton, in the north of the city. The diminutive channel here is easy to overlook, but it nevertheless still provides a great green corridor for connecting wildlife throughout the city. Under

urls.title: Corby man jailed and facing costs of £750,000 for waste crime
urls.description: A Northamptonshire man, who was jailed in January, after a decade of waste offences was ordered this week to pay £12,500 in costs and £140 in victim surcharge.

tweets.text:
A 68-year-old man faces jail time and is ordered to clean up stock-piled waste which could cost him £750,000.

If you suspect any illegal waste activity, please call: 0800 80 70 60

Read more about how we combat #illegal waste here: https://t.co/cksMMi14Qt https://t.co/3Bc9L1ic09

urls.title: PFAS poisoning: Why is so little known about the presence of ‘forever chemicals’ in UK drinking water?
urls.description: Toxic PFAS is in the blood of almost everyone in the world. It is a problem whose significance is understood in America, Australia and across Europe, but less so in the UK, where awareness of the chemicals and their devastating health impacts is unusually low.

tweets.text:
In the US manufactures of PFAS chemicals have paid out almost £1bn for poisoning drinking water.

In Australia several towns ordered not to drink tap water.

In Italy 350,000 residents are suing local companies for poisoning tap water.

Here in the UK?

https://t.co/y7sHZpSiwP
